verses.plain: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

tokens.t: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
far from helping me,
the words of my roaring?

verses.plain: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

tokens.t: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

verses.plain: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

tokens.t: But thou
holy,
that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

verses.plain: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

tokens.t: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

verses.plain: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

tokens.t: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

verses.plain: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

tokens.t: But I
a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

verses.plain: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

tokens.t: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head,

verses.plain: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

tokens.t: He trusted on the
he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

verses.plain: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother’s breasts.

tokens.t: But thou
he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope
upon my mother’s breasts.

verses.plain: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.

tokens.t: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou
my God from my mother’s belly.

verses.plain: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

tokens.t: Be not far from me; for trouble
near; for
none to help.

verses.plain: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.

tokens.t: Many bulls have compassed me: strong
of Bashan have beset me round.

verses.plain: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

tokens.t: They gaped upon me
their mouths,
a ravening and a roaring lion.

verses.plain: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

tokens.t: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

verses.plain: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

tokens.t: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

verses.plain: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

tokens.t: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

verses.plain: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

tokens.t: I may tell all my bones: they look
stare upon me.

verses.plain: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

tokens.t: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

verses.plain: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

tokens.t: But be not thou far from me, O
: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

verses.plain: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

tokens.t: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

verses.plain: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

tokens.t: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

verses.plain: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

tokens.t: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

verses.plain: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

tokens.t: Ye that fear the
, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

verses.plain: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

tokens.t: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

verses.plain: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

tokens.t: My praise
of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

verses.plain: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

tokens.t: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the
that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

verses.plain: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

tokens.t: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the
: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

verses.plain: For the kingdom is the LORD’s: and he is the governor among the nations.

tokens.t: For the kingdom
the
: and he
the governor among the nations.

verses.plain: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

tokens.t: All
fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

verses.plain: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

tokens.t: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

verses.plain: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.

tokens.t: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done

footnotes.text: Aijeleth…: or, the hind of the morning
am…: Heb. there is no silence to me
He trusted…: Heb. He rolled himself on
seeing…: or, if he delight in
didst…: or, kept me in safety
gaped…: Heb. opened their mouths against me
my darling: Heb. my only one
